title: Peter Schiff Slams Trump’s Bitcoin Reserve Plan After 12% Loss
body: Bitcoin critic Peter Schiff has once again taken a jab at Trump’s US Bitcoin Reserve plan as BTC price slumped recently amid a broader crypto market crash. Simultaneously, he reiterated his view on how the US could have made profits if they had sold BTC to buy gold under the new administration. Peter Schiff Mocks US Bitcoin Reserve Plan; Pushes For Gold Strategy Economist and Bitcoin critic Peter Schiff has once again criticized Donald Trump’s Bitcoin push. In a recent X post, he said the US would have been in a better financial position if it had chosen gold instead of Bitcoin Strategic Reserve. According to Schiff, the reserve, established on March 6, has already posted a 12% loss in value. In contrast, gold prices have slightly increased during the same period. Schiff said : “So far, the value of the Bitcoin held in that reserve has declined by over 12%. Had the U.S. sold it and added to our gold reserve, not only would we have avoided that loss, but we would now have a 2% gain.” Having said that, the US would have seen a 2% gain instead if it had shifted its focus towards the precious metal. In other words, Schiff reiterated his view that how gold remains the safer bet in uncertain economic times. However, when another user pointed out that the Biden administration had already missed massive BTC gains years ago by selling early, Peter Schiff dismissed the claim. He responded that such comparisons are “irrelevant,” noting that profits or losses should be judged only from the moment the official reserve began. Peter Schiff Warns Of US Recession In a separate post, Schiff also raised red flags over the US economy. He linked Trump’s rising tariff plans to a possible recession and warned investors to brace for a sharp market downturn. According to him, the stock market hasn’t factored in the economic damage such trade policies could cause. He further stated that even with the recent dip and crypto market crash , equities remain overvalued. If a recession hits, the US could face its worst economic downturn since the Great Depression. Schiff said even a 50% market drop might not be enough to reflect the true scale of the crisis. Can The US Fed Save The Economy? While Peter Schiff has warned over a potential US Recession after slamming Donald Trump’s Bitcoin Reserve plan, a user said that the recession is unlikely. However, responding to the user, Schiff sarcastically said that only the US Federal Reserve could stop it. However, he warned that doing so would require pumping more liquidity into the system, potentially triggering runaway inflation. Considering that, along with Trump’s recent threat of an additional 50% Tariff on China has fueled market concerns. Meanwhile, despite all these concerns, the market has recorded a strong recovery today, with the BTC price soaring to the $80K mark. However, investors must consider the current macroeconomic woes and other factors before putting their bets amid this uncertain period. The post Peter Schiff Slams Trump’s Bitcoin Reserve Plan After 12% Loss appeared first on CoinGape .
tags: 24/7 Cryptocurrency News|Peter Schiff|Peter Schiff Bitcoin|US Bitcoin Reserve|US recession

title: XRP Could Hit $12.5 Before President Trump's Term Ends: Standard Chartered
body: XRP could rise to $12.50 before President Trump leaves office, investment bank Standard Chartered (STAN) said in a report on Tuesday initiating coverage of the Ripple-related token. Standard Chartered predicts that XRP will reach $5.50 by the end of this year, $8 by 2026 year-end, $10.40 by the end of 2027, and $12.50 by end-2028. At the time of writing, XRP was trading almost 9% higher at $1.94. The bank noted that XRP rose sixfold following Donald Trump's election victory in November, reflecting expectations that the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) would drop its appeal against Ripple , and because of the potential approval of XRP exchange-traded funds (ETFs). Such gains are sustainable, the bank said, in part due to leadership changes at the SEC, but also because "XRP is uniquely positioned at the heart of one of the fastest-growing use cases for digital assets - facilitation of cross-border and cross-currency payments." "XRPL is similar to the main use case for stablecoins such as Tether: blockchain-enabled financial transactions that have traditionally been done through traditional financial (TradFi) institutions," wrote Geoffrey Kendrick, head of digital assets research at Standard Chartered Bank. Stablecoin transactions are expected to increase tenfold in the next four years, the report said. Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies whose value is tied to another asset, such as the U.S. dollar or gold. They play a major role in cryptocurrency markets and are also used for to transfer money internationally. Ripple is also planning to push XRPL into the tokenization space, the bank noted. XRPL is XRP's decentralized public blockchain, and is used for payments. These positive factors mean that XRP should keep up with its larger peer bitcoin (BTC), in terms of price appreciation, the bank said. XRPL suffers from two flaws, the small number of developers and its limited value capture, but these are more than offset by positive tailwinds, the report added. Read more: First XRP ETF in the U.S. to Go Live on Tuesday With Launch of Teucrium’s Leveraged Fund

title: Decoding AUD/JPY: Expert Forecast Reveals Limited Upside – Smart Forex Insights
body: Navigating the turbulent waters of the Forex market can feel like deciphering ancient runes, especially when dealing with pairs like AUD/JPY. For cryptocurrency enthusiasts also keeping an eye on traditional markets, understanding Forex movements can provide valuable insights into global risk sentiment and potential shifts in capital flows. Recently, financial giant Citi has released its analysis on the Australian Dollar against the Japanese Yen (AUD/JPY), and their outlook might surprise you. Let’s dive into Citi’s AUD/JPY forecast and understand why they predict limited upside for this popular currency pair after it reached key targets. Understanding Citi’s Forex Market Outlook on AUD/JPY Citi, a major player in global financial services, has issued a report suggesting that the bullish run for AUD/JPY might be losing steam. This isn’t just a casual observation; it’s a data-driven analysis based on market trends, economic indicators, and a deep understanding of global financial dynamics. But what exactly does ‘limited upside’ mean, and why should traders, including those interested in crypto, pay attention? Target Achieved: Citi believes that AUD/JPY has already reached its projected target levels. This means that the factors that initially drove the pair upwards may have played out. Shifting Market Dynamics: The global economic landscape is constantly evolving. Changes in interest rates, commodity prices, and geopolitical events can significantly impact currency valuations. Citi’s analysis likely incorporates these shifts. Technical Indicators: Financial institutions like Citi employ sophisticated technical analysis to identify trends and potential reversal points. These indicators might be signaling a slowdown in AUD/JPY’s upward momentum. Risk Sentiment: AUD/JPY is often considered a risk-on currency pair. Changes in global risk appetite can heavily influence its direction. Citi’s outlook might reflect a perceived shift in risk sentiment that could limit further gains. For those familiar with the crypto market’s volatility, the Forex market might seem comparatively stable, but subtle shifts can still present significant trading opportunities and risks. Understanding expert analysis, like Citi’s Forex market outlook , is crucial for making informed decisions, whether you’re trading currencies, stocks, or even cryptocurrencies. What Drives AUD/JPY? Key Factors in Currency Trading Analysis To truly grasp Citi’s perspective, it’s essential to understand the fundamental drivers of AUD/JPY. Several factors interplay to influence the value of this currency pair. Let’s break down some of the key elements that form the basis of any robust currency trading analysis : Factor Impact on AUD/JPY Interest Rate Differentials The difference in interest rates between Australia and Japan is a primary driver. Higher Australian interest rates generally make the AUD more attractive to investors, increasing demand and potentially pushing AUD/JPY higher. Commodity Prices Australia is a major exporter of commodities like iron ore and coal. Rising commodity prices tend to boost the Australian economy and the AUD. Conversely, Japan is a commodity importer, so higher prices can negatively impact the JPY. Global Risk Sentiment AUD/JPY is often seen as a proxy for global risk appetite. In times of economic optimism and low risk aversion, investors tend to favor higher-yielding currencies like the AUD, leading to potential gains in AUD/JPY. Conversely, during periods of uncertainty, investors may flock to safe-haven currencies like the JPY, potentially weakening AUD/JPY. Japanese Yen as a Safe Haven The Japanese Yen is traditionally considered a safe-haven currency. During global economic downturns or periods of heightened risk, investors often seek refuge in the JPY, increasing its demand and potentially causing AUD/JPY to decline. Economic Data Releases Economic data from both Australia and Japan, such as GDP growth, inflation figures, and employment numbers, can significantly impact currency valuations. Strong Australian data generally supports the AUD, while strong Japanese data supports the JPY. By considering these factors, analysts like those at Citi develop their Australian Dollar Yen forecasts. Their ‘limited upside’ view likely stems from an assessment of these factors, suggesting that the current balance may not favor further significant gains for AUD/JPY in the near term. Citi’s AUD/JPY Analysis: Digging Deeper into Limited Upside Citi’s analysis isn’t just a simple statement; it’s a nuanced perspective derived from in-depth market research. To understand the implications of their Citi AUD/JPY forecast, we need to consider the potential reasons behind their view. Why might the upside be limited even after AUD/JPY has reached its targets? Overbought Conditions: After a significant rally, AUD/JPY might be considered ‘overbought’ from a technical analysis perspective. This means that the price has risen too quickly and may be due for a correction or consolidation. Potential Shift in Interest Rate Expectations: While Australia currently has higher interest rates than Japan, future expectations can change. If markets anticipate a potential slowdown in Australian rate hikes or a possible shift in Japanese monetary policy, it could reduce the attractiveness of AUD/JPY. Commodity Price Volatility: While commodity prices have been supportive of the AUD, they are inherently volatile. A downturn in commodity markets could remove a significant tailwind for the Australian Dollar. Global Economic Slowdown Concerns: Growing concerns about a global economic slowdown could dampen risk appetite, potentially favoring safe-haven currencies like the JPY over risk-on currencies like the AUD. Geopolitical Risks: Unforeseen geopolitical events can trigger sudden shifts in market sentiment and currency valuations. Increased global uncertainty could boost demand for safe-haven assets, including the Yen. Understanding these potential headwinds is crucial for anyone involved in currency trading analysis . Citi’s ‘limited upside’ view isn’t necessarily bearish, but it suggests that traders should be cautious about expecting substantial further gains in AUD/JPY without significant new positive catalysts. Actionable Insights: Navigating AUD/JPY in a Limited Upside Scenario So, what does Citi’s analysis mean for traders? Even with a forecast of limited upside, there are still strategies and approaches to consider when dealing with Australian Dollar Yen . Here are some actionable insights: Manage Expectations: Don’t chase aggressive long positions in AUD/JPY expecting rapid gains. Citi’s analysis suggests a more cautious approach might be warranted. Focus on Short-Term Opportunities: Even in a range-bound or consolidating market, short-term trading opportunities can arise. Focus on technical levels and intraday movements. Consider Range Trading Strategies: If AUD/JPY enters a period of consolidation, range trading strategies, such as buying at support and selling at resistance, could be effective. Monitor Key Economic Data: Pay close attention to economic data releases from both Australia and Japan, as well as global economic indicators. Unexpected data can trigger shifts in market sentiment and create trading opportunities. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don’t over-allocate your trading capital to a single currency pair. Diversification across different currency pairs and asset classes can help manage risk. Stay Informed: Keep abreast of the latest market analysis and news from reputable sources like Citi. Market conditions can change rapidly, and staying informed is crucial for making sound trading decisions. For cryptocurrency traders, understanding Forex dynamics can be a valuable addition to your market knowledge. The principles of risk management, technical analysis, and fundamental analysis apply across different markets, and insights from the Forex world can often provide a broader perspective on global financial trends. Conclusion: A Measured Approach to AUD/JPY Trading Citi’s analysis of limited upside for AUD/JPY serves as a valuable reminder of the importance of measured expectations and informed decision-making in trading. While the pair may have reached its targets, the Forex market is ever-evolving. By understanding the factors influencing AUD/JPY forecast , recognizing potential headwinds, and adopting appropriate trading strategies, market participants can navigate this currency pair effectively even in a potentially less bullish environment. Whether you’re a seasoned Forex trader or a crypto enthusiast expanding your market awareness, staying informed and adaptable is the key to success in the dynamic world of financial markets. title: Ripple Acquires Hidden Road for $1.25 Billion
body: The post Ripple Acquires Hidden Road for $1.25 Billion appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Ripple has announced its acquisition of Hidden Road for $1.25 billion, marking a major step in the crypto world. With this deal, Ripple becomes the first crypto company to own and run a global, multi-asset prime broker. The partnership aims to deliver digital asset services to institutional clients at scale, creating a stronger bridge between traditional finance and decentralized finance. This move highlights Ripple’s push to lead innovation and expand crypto’s role in mainstream financial markets.

title: Why This Crypto Coin Could Outpace SOL, ADA, XRP & Dogec in 2025
body: In a market frequently influenced by hype and speculation, cryptocurrency investors are beginning to consider alternatives to the popular coins, such as Solana (SOL), Cardano (ADA), XRP, and Dogecoin (DOGE). They are looking for other projects that offer utility and have growth potential. Although these tokens solidified their distinct positions, they face challenges such as dependence on market sentiment, regulation uncertainty, and scalability. Introducing Rexas Finance (RXS), a new crypto coin gaining traction, not for viral tweets or attractive partnerships, but for its fundamental method of tokenizing real-world assets (RWAs). By connecting traditional finance with blockchain technology, Rexas Finance might discreetly emerge as one of the most significant success stories in 2025. Why This Crypto Coin Could Outpace SOL, ADA, XRP & DOGE in 2025 Rexas Finance is rapidly positioning itself as the crypto coin to watch in 2025. Going Past Hype: Reasons Investors Are Seeking Alternatives Dogecoin (DOGE) is recognized as the first meme coin and the largest by market cap. Solana is popular for its speed, Cardano for its scholarly approach, and XRP for cross-border transactions. However, despite their popularity, these crypto coins also have their limitations. Solana has been scrutinized for network downtimes, XRP’s regulatory challenges, Cardano’s slow development pace, and DOGE’s lack of utility. Nevertheless, in 2025, the actual growth might occur in different areas. What Distinguishes Rexas Finance? Rexas Finance is developing a straightforward yet impactful idea: converting physical assets such as real estate, commodities, and collectibles into tokens, and providing them as fractional investments. By doing this, it is enabling average investors to access high-value markets more easily Here’s why that matters: Barrier-free entry: Traditional investments in real estate or fine art require significant capital and legal navigation. Tokenization simplifies this with fractional ownership. Liquidity in illiquid markets: While traditional asset markets are often slow-moving, tokenized assets can be traded easily, opening up more flexibility for investors. Diversification in a volatile market: Crypto is famously volatile. By tying digital assets to real-world value, Rexas Finance provides a unique hedge against market swings. Strong momentum: A Closer Look at the RWA Crypto Coin Numbers Rexas Finance isn’t just an idea, it is gaining real traction. 600% presale growth: RXS jumped from $0.03 to $0.20 across 12 presale stages. Over $47 million raised: More than 457 million of the RWA tokens were sold, a number that speaks to rising investor confidence. Upcoming listing: On June 19, 2025, Rexas Finance is set to list on at least three major exchanges, priced at $0.25 per token. This milestone could bring a major liquidity boost and broader exposure. Tokenomics & Tech: Built for Longevity Rexas Finance has implemented deflationary tokenomics with a fixed supply of 1 billion tokens. Token allocations are designated for staking, liquidity pools, and presales, helping to prevent over-dilution and support long-term value. Rexas Finance tokenomics The project also passed a Certik audit, and its listings on CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko have added visibility. To top it off, the Rexas AI Shield offers proactive smart contract security, something many projects only address reactively. Growing Buzz: A Strategic Giveaway To spark early engagement, Rexas Finance is giving away $1 million worth of RXS, with the top 20 participants each set to receive $50,000. The campaign has already garnered over 1.6 million entries, making it one of the most hyped token launches this year, not because of celebrity endorsements but due to its utility-driven promise. The Case for The New Crypto Coin Outperforming SOL, ADA, XRP, and DOGE So why might Rexas Finance outpace these established names in 2025? Grounded in real value: While many top coins rely heavily on network effects or market speculation, RXS derives its strength from asset-backed investment strategies. First-mover in a growing sector: The RWA tokenization space is still relatively young, and Rexas Finance is positioned as a fast-mover, and among the best new cryptocurrencies to invest in. Appeal to institutions: Tokenized assets are attracting the attention of financial giants. As institutions enter the space, Rexas could benefit from being ahead of the curve. Stability with upside: Tying crypto to real-world assets could offer a middle ground that is less risky than meme coins but with higher growth potential than traditional assets. Final Thoughts Rexas Finance isn’t trying to be the next Solana or XRP. It’s playing a different game, connecting blockchain to real-world finance in a way that’s accessible, scalable, and investor-friendly. For those looking to diversify beyond the usual crypto headlines and into projects with meaningful utility, RXS is one to keep on your radar in 2025. title: Cardano (ADA) Price Action Analysis: Bulls Eye $1 Amid Momentum Surge
body: Cardano (ADA) is currently priced at $0.6025, down 1.24%, after a sharp recovery from the $0.5220 support. While the recent bounce shows promise, the broader market structure remains fragile. Here’s a concise analysis across timeframes, technical patterns, indicators, and key levels. Key Patterns across Timeframes Falling Wedge (4H/1H): On the 4-hour and 1-hour charts, a falling wedge pattern has played out. This bullish reversal structure broke to the upside near $0.5520, with ADA now attempting to reclaim the mid-range at $0.5800–$0.6040. A clean break above that level could confirm trend reversal and target $0.6300 next. Double Bottom (30M): The 30-minute chart shows a double bottom at $0.5220, a strong sign of local support. Price is currently testing the neckline at $0.5800. A breakout would affirm short-term upside potential. Bullish Flag (15M): A bullish flag is forming on the 15-minute chart after the bounce. Consolidation under resistance suggests a bullish continuation if volume supports a breakout above $0.5800. Indicator Analysis Bollinger Bands: On the 4H, the price bounced off the lower Bollinger Band and climbed toward the mid-band at $0.6048. A successful close above this level could pave the way to the upper band around $0.6875. BB squeeze on the 1H indicates incoming volatility. MACD: MACD on the 4H and 1H has just crossed bullish, and histogram bars have turned positive—signaling a momentum shift in favor of buyers. RSI: RSI across all timeframes has risen from oversold zones (below 30) to neutral (45–55), suggesting bullish momentum is building but not yet overbought—leaving room for further upside. Volume: Volume surged on the initial bounce from $0.5220, showing strong buying interest. However, the continuation volume remains moderate. Sustained upward pressure requires increased participation. Support & Resistance Support: $0.5520, $0.5220 Resistance: $0.6048, $0.6300, $0.6875 Fundamental Perspective Cardano’s fundamentals remain intact: active development, ongoing scaling improvements (Hydra), and growing DeFi adoption. However, the price remains reactive to Bitcoin movements and broader risk sentiment. ADA typically lags in breakout performance but holds mid-term potential for accumulation phases. Price Target ADA’s breakout from the falling wedge and recent bullish signals suggest a short-term upside toward $0.6048, with a potential extension to $0.63–$0.6875 and $1.0. A rejection at $0.5800 would likely bring ADA back to test $0.5520. Bulls must reclaim key resistance with volume to sustain this move.
